009
010package imagingbook.common.corners;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * This is an implementation of the Harris/Stephens corner detector, as described in [1].
019 * See Sec. 6.2 of [2] for additional details.
020 * This class extends {@link GradientCornerDetector} (where most
021 * of the work is done) by defining a specific corner score function.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] C. G. Harris and M. Stephens. A combined corner and edge
025 * detector. In C. J. Taylor, editor, 4th Alvey Vision Conference,
026 * pp. 147â€“151, Manchester (1988).
027 * <br>
028 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
029 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/03/30
034 */
035public class HarrisCornerDetector extends GradientCornerDetector {
036        
037        public static final double DefaultAlpha = 0.05;
038
039        private double alpha = DefaultAlpha;
040
041        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
042        
043        public HarrisCornerDetector(ImageProcessor ip, Parameters params) {
044                super(ip, params);
045        }
046        
047        /**
048         * Set the sensitivity parameter &alpha; (alpha) for the corner score function.
049         * @param alpha sensitivity parameter (default is 0.05)
050         */
051        public void setAlpha(double alpha) {
052                this.alpha = alpha;
053        }
054        
055        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
056
057        @Override
058        protected float getCornerScore(float a, float b, float c) {
059                double det = a * b - sqr(c);
060                double trace = a + b;
061                double score = det - alpha * sqr(trace);
062                return (float) Math.sqrt(0.5 * score);  // returns 100 for default threshold = 20000
063        }
064        
065}
